item.description:
Join me for a New Year's Day stroll of the trails and former carriage roads of Ravenswood.  There are some great spots at this park, including the Magnolia Swamp and a viewpoint of the Harbor.  I would say this is very light hiking...really walking, but expect some stumps/roots, loose gravel, boulders to be passed around, some inclines (or stepping down), snow or ice depending upon trail conditions.  I guess if you had microspikes or other traction devices you could bring them just in case.  Also, please dress for the weather, in comfortable layers (avoid cotton), and wear boots or shoes that have really good traction (I would anticipate that some areas could potentially be slick) and bring water.  This is dog friendly hike for very well behaved, very social dogs..both people and canine friendly :)  I have been to this park a few times, but this will still be fairly exploratory, since it's been a while!  However, it's unlikely we could get very lost for any length of time, and I'll have some maps with me...but just be ready to explore along with me if necessary :)  I hope to get 1.5-2 hrs of walking in. 

This walk will be cancelled due to lack of interest or inclement weather. 

PLEASE NOTE: This was initially posted with Social Fun, another Meetup group, which has several members signed up to attend...hence the lower limit here.  Please pay $1 to help offset Meetup group dues when you arrive to this walk.

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: New Year's Day Walk at Ravenswood- with Social Fun
